title: Risk/Reward: Why Intelligent Leaps and Daring Choices
description:
Risk/Reward: Why Intelligent Leaps and Daring Choices Are the Best Career Moves You Can Make by Anne Kreamer

English | June 9, 2015 | ISBN: 1400067987 | 224 Pages | True AZW3 (Kindle)/(EPUB/PDF conv) | 3.9 MB

A persuasive and eye-opening look at the importance of embracing risk in our working livesÃ¢â‚¬â€and how to use it to achieve lifelong career success.

Some of us relish the chance to fly without a net, others . . . not so much. But no matter how adventurous we might be in our personal lives, most of us are wary of allowing risk into our careers. With an economy in constant flux and a job market in which uncertainty is the only constant, stepping outside oneÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s comfort zone can feel dangerous. But as the findings of this eye-opening and urgent book attest, the avoidance of risk might pose the greatest danger of all to our career prospects.

In Risk/Reward, trend-spotter and career guru Anne Kreamer makes the compelling case that embracing risk is essential to managing a twenty-first-century career. Risk-taking isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t just for entrepreneurs, nor does it require working on a figurative tightrope. Rather, Kreamer says, conscious, consistent, and modest risk-taking can help us become more able to recognize opportunity when it appears, and more likely to seize the chance to make the right change at the right moment
